SENT.plain: BACKGROUND: since October 1999, nicardipine pellets (NP) have been used to prevent vasospasm in patients with subarachnoid hemorrhage (SAH)
We started a multicenter cooperative study on Jan 1, 2007, and 136 patients in six hospitals were enrolled to this trial in 2 years
The incidence of cerebral vasospasm and outcome were examined in these patients
METHODS: the patients with SAH were treated with NP during surgery after clipping of their aneurysms
FINDINGS: the study included 87 female patients, 38 over 70 years old, 34 in grades 4 and 5, and 46 of Fisher group 2 or 4
Aneurysms were located on anterior circulation in 133, posterior in 3
All patients were treated with Fasudil hydrochloride except for 3
Two to twelve pellets were implanted in the cistern where thick clots existed and vasospasm was highly likely
Delayed ischemic neurological deficits (DIND), angiographical vasospasm and cerebral infarctions were seen in 11 of 134 (8.2%), 32 of 130 patients (24.6%), and 16 of 129 (12.4%), respectively
CONCLUSIONS: the incidence of cerebral vasospasm in this multicenter trial is similar to that of our first trial performed in a single center
